phrases: New Wagashi Revives Town Spring Comes to Kamogawa New Anti-NEET Strategy Labor Ministry Emergency Funding
The Labor Ministry has allocated special funding
I am about done for the day, too.
to combat the rise in NEETs and shut-ins.
This will help support their return to normal society, and...
It is been a while, huh?
You quit your first job after three months?
Well, it just was not the right direction for me.
I felt I could live up to my potential elsewhere.
You knew that in just three months?
The ability to make such decisions and take initiative is also my strong point.
Anything going on where you work?
I am hanging in there, I guess.
Well, how did the interview go?
It just did not work out.
I hate to kick you when you are down...
We are not sendin' you any money from next month.
High time you stood on your own feet.
How did my life turn out like this?
Nice to meet you, Kaizaki Arata-san.
Finished grad school with a job lined up.
But you quit that job in only three months.
While you work part-time to make ends meet,
you are twenty-seven and have no steady job.
I am Yoake Ryo, from the ReLIFE Laboratory.
I will cut right to the chase.
You have been selected as a test subject for ReLIFE.
We would like your help with an experiment.
The experiment will last for one year.
We will pay for all living expenses during that time.
And, depending on how things go,
we might hook you up with a job afterward.
What exactly will I be doing?
Do I have your attention now?
Take this, and you will look like you are in...
Like you are in high school again!
For a year starting this spring...
and go back to high school!
Who in their right mind would?
I see you took the pill already.
I do not even remember taking it.
That is a deadbeat for you.
So, that pretty much covers the school you will be attending.
Like I said yesterday, we will pay for all living expenses.
Bit late for that, is not it?
And going to school every day for a year sounds like a pain.
You are thinking high school sounds like a pain, are not you?
Will you become a student for a year and
see this as a chance to change your life?
Or will you get cold feet, back out, and keep living as a NEET?
It was rough on you, right?
Pretending you had a real job in front of your friends.
If you are ready to accept, please sign the contract.
None of this seems real at all.
But I have come too far to turn back!
I can live off this for a year,
and if all goes well, I will get a job after that!
I will do this ReLIFE thing!
Here is to a good ReLIFE.
First year would be one thing, but I am starting out in third?
Secured a seat in the back.
The names are posted on the blackboard.
We have been assigned seats according to our roll numbers.
And I accidentally used formal speech!
We are in the same class again!
Let us have another good year.
Nice to see a familiar face!
I am Amatsu, your homeroom teacher.
I am a bit nervous because I have never been in charge of third years before,
but let us make it a good year.
She might even be younger than me.
Well, it is the first day.
I was in Class 3 in second year, too.
I am not in any clubs.
He was a student here last year, too?
Is he not really a grown-up?
Is he actually a high schooler?
I am not in any clubs.
A year surrounded by these bright, young things.
I just transferred in this year.
So I have not joined a club.
I am nervous because I am in a new environment, but I hope to have
a great year with you all.
Introductions are a piece of cake.
I have a bit of a cold.
I am on the volleyball team.
Guess I should start with remembering the names of the people sitting near me.
Part of the Going Straight Home Club.
I transferred in this year, too.
I already got lost on the way here and was late for school.
But it is great to be here.
Guess I am not the only transfer student.
As fellow transfer students, let us help each other out, Kaizaki-kun.
I can legally be friends with high school girls?
Well, now that we are done with the introductions...
Let us get the tests started!
I was not told about this!
I do not want to see anything but stationery.
But, hey, I went to grad school.
Maybe I will actually do all right.
Students always have one in their bag.
When do adults forget that habit?
Kaizaki-kun, let me take a look at your bag.
She thinks I am trying to cheat.
But there is nothing in there.
I just brought it out of habit!
Okay, I have got to use these tests to reclaim my good name...
I cannot tell the teacher now!
I was in real trouble there.
Feel free to keep'them till the tests are over...
Maybe you should have stayed home.
I cannot miss these tests, no matter what.
These tests decide who gets to be class rep.
Kariu held that position for all of last year.
She always had the top score in our class.
she is in the same class as Hishiro-san, the top scorer in our grade.
So she is all fired up now and could not call in sick.
In every sense of the word...
Did I ever understand that stuff?
I am not so sure anymore.
Go home, chug some beers, and sleep.
You would better not be running.
You are way too young to be smoking!
When you grow up, you will definitely regret it.
If you make a habit out of smoking, you will get addicted!
It is especially easy to get hooked at your age!
You will not be able to quit!
I will be twenty-five this year.
If you are looking down on me'because I am young, I will knock your lights out.
I-I did not mean it like that!
Kids like you must think twenty-five is super old.
But no, I actually think it is impressive.
You are so young, but you have a proper job.
Truth is, often people do not take me seriously because of my age.
So having you say that is pretty nice.
You are still not worming your way out of this!
Your first day was a disaster.
Your own, do not you think?
The high schooler or the grown-up?
Like girls who ask how old you think they are!
It is my job to observe and report about your year here.
The rules say the handler must turn back the clock
and support the subject as a fellow student.
Why did not you tell me?
Well, I just wanted to see that look of shock on your face!
Then what was that about being in Class 2-3?
Why were you a student last year?
Cannot have the supporter struggle to come to grips with student life.
So, how does it feel, being in high school after so long?
Everyone is got friends, and they are starting to
freak out about college entrance exams.
I am pretty sure I told you that ReLIFE is a program to rehabilitate NEETs.
Why would not it be tough?
Try not to depend on me too much.
No point in being a high schooler if you just hang out with another adult.
I just want to fund this year of my life and get that job afterward.
If I can blend in and stay in the background all year, that is fine with me.
Whether you enjoy it or play it safe,
I think it is best you experience your ReLIFE however you want.
I will not speak to you formally at school, so please get used to it.
Feel free to use casual speech yourself.
But I guess you always have.
You can call me Ryo, too!
Looks like it could work out, yeah.
Say hi to Dad for me.
Had not checked the schedule, and was very unprepared.
While it is impossible to ascertain how he will spend the upcoming year...
Unlike Subject No. 001, the failed sample from last year...
will surely live a fulfilling ReLIFE.
What kind of music do you listen to, Yoake-san?
Well, I find it hard to get into modern music.
All I do is listen to old tracks on MDs.
